elements.title: Forest Park Carousel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after the Forest Park Carousel (pictured) was acquired for $30,000 in 1972, one of its later operators likened the deal to "buying a Rembrandt for $25"?

elements.title: Elisabeth Waterhouse (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Elisabeth Waterhouse founded the National Chamber Music Course summer school in 1974 and has managed it since?

elements.title: Soviet cruiser Vasily Chapayev (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Soviet cruiser Vasily Chapayev was ordered to sail on 24 December 1976, but its crew refused to comply, causing the removal of its senior officers?

elements.title: Dawid Celt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dawid Celt was Agnieszka Radwańska's hitting partner before he became her domestic partner?

elements.title: Kill All the Things (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the actor who played Screech on Saved by the Bell portrayed Harvey Weinstein in a music video for the song "Kill All the Things"?

elements.title: Meantime (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that comedian Frankie Boyle's debut novel Meantime is about a Glaswegian drug addict investigating his friend's death?

elements.title: Bella Figura (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jiří Kylián had all the dancers in his ballet Bella Figura appear topless to equalise men and women?

elements.title: Tom Forrestall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Canadian artist Tom Forrestall spent six months painting his own car?
